headline: Herbed Dumplings
description: Savory dumplings for beef or chicken stew.
name: Herbed Dumplings

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, thyme, parsley, and oregano. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add milk, using just enough to form a thick batter.
Drop by rounded tablespoons into your simmering soup or stew, cover, and allow to cook 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is primarily to let you know that this recipe works with Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free 1:1 flour. The dumplings cook up soft and fluffy. They're not quite as good, there's no chewy outside, and they kind of collapse when you chew them, but they're close and totally worth making. On the topic of salt, IF you're using unsalted butter AND kosher salt, the full teaspoon is fine.
So tasty. I made them with a beef casserole for our Friday night supper. Firm favourite!
I just put the dumplings in the stew will have to let you know how they taste
I loved the recipe. The salt was too much though. Next time Iâ€™ll probably go for a quarter teaspoon. But the dumplings turned out amazing ðŸ˜»

I was in a hurry and didn't read the reviews before making the dumplings. I LOVE salt and they were way to salty for me! However, the herbs completed my chicken stew very well. I will make them again but cut the salt in half.
I found them too salty. That may also have been caused by the baking Soda. Next time I make them, Iâ€™ll cut the salt in half and leave out the baking soda.

I decided to make dumplings with my chicken stew in the instant pot but was trying to figure out how to make the dumplings work. so I baked them instead, and they turned out fantastic! I also cut back on the spices just a bit.
Good flavor. Needed to add more milk. Had a tough time with the consistency. Very sticky and challenging to drop into boiling liquid. I used chicken broth to boil the dumplings.
Great recipe, just the right amount of spices. Picky husband even liked them!!
Delicious. I like the herbs in the measurements provided, in contrast of what others have said. I used Himalayan pink salt and 1/2 C almond flour
I loved the amount of herbs suggested in the recipe and I added some basil and pepper to boot.
These dumplings are absolutely amazing! We used this recipe for chicken and dumplings and it was perfect.

For almost 20 years now I have made dozens of different recipes for dumplings, and none ever, EVER, came out to my satisfaction. I tried this recipe because it was the only one I have ever come across that called for baking SODA (and baking powder as well). They came out big and airey, just the way I feel a dumpling should be. Does anyone know what the added ingredient of baking soda does?

Never made dumplings before, easy and tasty. My company loved them
Barb K
Made this three times now it is excellent. The dumplings are so flavorful.

They were delicious! Used our empire apples from the backyard tree! Next time I will thicken the sauce a little more and put less filling in each turnover so they don't ooze as much. But they were very easy and tasty
Iâ€™ve made these dumplings several times. Our use the exact recipe and they came out perfect. My son loves them
Absolutely amazing!
Yummy!
Delicious. Substituted coconut oil for butter, and plain, full fat yogurt for milk. Added granulated garlic for a little extra flavour. Will be making again and again.
The dumplings were the best I've ever made. Great taste and texture! I stuck to the recipe except added only 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Thanks for the recipe!
Yes I made them and they were so easy and turned out fluffy & delish! Doubled everything except herbs. Really really like them a lot!
Adapted to gluten free blend, plus turmeric, using 1 egg + water, into a Turkey lentil soup, and dumplings were delicious, not too hard nor soft, cooking up in 20 minutes ( 10 uncovered, 10 covered)

I reduced herbs, salt, and baking powder (high altitude). Remember, tightly close the lid. Put a towel between the lid and pot to keep condensation from dropping on them (thanks Cookâ€™s Illustrated!). Add 10-15 min coming time for high altitude. Iâ€™m just over 5,000 ft. Very good savory dumplings. You can play w the liquid, use water, broth, milk, buttermilk. Theyâ€™re still delish!

Great recipe! For liquid, I used 1 beaten egg and enough milk to equal 3/4 cup. Kneaded a few times on a floured surface, then let rest for 5 minutes. Rolled out to 1/8" thickness and cut into rectangles with a pizza cutter. I let them dry for one hour, then added to my soup. Perfect and tastes great.
Great recipe. I will use this again. Everyone loved the dumplings. Remember donâ€™t lift the lid while they are cooking!

im not a dumpling person. Only because i have tried them in the past and always failed, but tonight I added this recipe to my beef stew and i loved them. i made some changes as suggested by reviewers- cut down the salt by half, 1c buttermilk instead of the 3/4C of milk. They turned out so airy and light and not too salty but full of flavor. Going to be adding this to my soups and stews regularly now. They double in size when cooked so be aware not to crowd the pot TOO much. Thank you for the recipe!

Loved this recipe! This was my first attempt at dumplings, and they came out great. I took the advice from others and did 1/4tsp salt and halved all of the seasonings as well. I also switched parsley for rosemary. Very fast and easy!
Made as written and enjoyed but will use half the herbs next time.
Very flavorful and easy to make.

I didn't have any parsley, but did add a "garlic lovers" seasoning mix instead which had some parsley in it. I should have read the reviews like I usually do and I would have definitely cut back on the thyme and oregano! My kids loved them as is, I thought the herbs were overpowering. Also had to cook/steam the dumplings twice as long (I think I scooped them too big!) very easy recipe and will make again (with 1/2 the seasonings!)

Cut the herbs and salt by half lest ye are a-salted and over herbed. I failed to heed the advise of others an paid the price. Also, I think fresh parsley works better. We always have some laying around for the household bunnies. And no, we don't make Hossenpfeffer in our home.

We just finished a dinner of bison top sirloin roasted with sweet and russet potatoes, carrots, onion, and this recipe of savory dumplings. They worked up easily and tasted great except a little too much salt, as another reviewer mentioned. My hubs didn't say anything negative about it but I thought so. I would be happy to make this again with a third less salt.
Cut spices in half. Make sure butter is room temp first to properly mix.
I cut the seasonings to 1/4 teaspoon and my family still didn't like it. Won't make again.
My husband and I tryed these with my chicken and dumplings and these were very yummy,!!!!

I only gave this recipe four stars because I had to half all the spices and salt. After the alterations, this recipe is perfect! This one goes into my special recipe box...after I changed it thanks to all the other reviews suggesting that I do.
I halved the recipe for just my husband and myself. It came out great. Will make again for sure. Thanks'
Love these dumplings. Adds something hearty to any soup.
I've been using this recipe exactly as written for years. Simple, delicious, and always gone before the soup is.
Most of my dumplings dissolved. Only a few survived. Maybe my "simmer" was too much.???
Thanks for all the great reviews over the years. Yes, just 1/4 to 1/2 tsp of salt needed. I don't know why the site won't let me edit my own recipe after a mis-print.
Fluffy, buttery dumplings. Beautiful, tasty treats that liven up any stew.
Easy and as delicious as my Mom's were!

The taste was fine, but I followed the recipe exactly and the 'dumplings' were completely dissolved at the fifteen minute mark. There was no stirring or disturbing the pot once the lid went on, so not really sure what went wrong.
I followed Andrea W's advice about the herbs & spices and I must say, the dumplings were a hit! Very tasty. I will keep this in my recipe box.
Really liked these . I doubled it and that was a good thing as they vanished as quickly as made!
I think they are perfect just the way they are. I would like the recipe for the chicken stew that you have posted with the dumplings if you have one.
Absolutely wonderful! My daughter asked why I haven't been making these all of her life. (20 years) Thank you for the great recipe.

I have made this recipe several times. It has always been amazing, fast and easy. I substitute coconut oil for the butter and have had zero taste or consistency issues. They are always light and fluffy and delicious.

I will never make another dumpling for soup. I've found my forever recipe.

I too have added these to a crockpot of beef or chicken stew - delicious! As there are only 2 of us I halve the recipe. When I make a stew, most of it gets frozen for future meals and DH always insists on dumplings when I reheat in the oven. Tonight I'm making the dumplings with just lots of fresh parsley instead of other herbs for a change. Thanks for this great recipe - it never fails.
Perfect dumplings, no changes needed. We made these to go with my fiancÃ©'s beef barley soup, and they hit the spot. I'll use this as my go to dumpling recipe from now on.
goopy mess
Loved this recipe! I didn't have the herbs on hand so I replaced it with 3/4 teaspoon of garlic salt. Tasted great and wasn't bland at all. I liked how it thickened up my chicken soup too.
Very good, but I did as others recommended and cut the salt to 1/4 teaspoon and 1 teaspoon of a Penzy's dried herb blend.
Very good, but a little to seasoned for me. Next time I am cutting the oregano to maybe 1/4 and I followed suggestions of cutting the salt in half. Very good though.

Delicious in "Hearty Turkey Soup". Used up leftover turkey, added these, and it was just like Mom used to make.

A really good variation is to add a half cup or so (adjust to taste) of cheddar or any cheese of your choice. My favorite is cheddar and pepper jack.
I did cut the salt back. Easy and delicious.

True confession time...I made these this afternoon because my husband forgot to buy the Rhemes frozen dumplings at the store this morning. (Oh the shame!) I followed the directions except I noticed pretty quickly I had only Oregano on hand in my understocked spice cabinet. (Again with the shame, lol.) I did have an Herbes de Provence Blend on hand and since it mostly had the same stuff, I subbed around 3 tbsps of it. I have never made dumplings before and wasn't aware of the "no peeking rule" but luckily my crockpot has a clear lid and I didn't peek enough to upset it too much. This is how we learn, haha! My results weren't pretty as a picture but the flavor was very good. I set the timer for 30 minutes and at that time, I took the lid off and stirred it gently to break them up a bit. Some of the dumplings denigrated completely but I like a thicker soup so it worked out. This is a very fluffy dumpling, as others have said, very bread or stuffing-like. I have never had a dumpling like these before, I am used to a more dense texture. Still, an easy recipe, flavorful results and a fun Sunday experiment. Thanks for sharing!
Used this recipe for dumplings for my chicken and dumplings...delish! Very simple and quick!
They were fantastic! I only used a bit of salt as I am not a heavy salt user. I will make these again.
They were awesome with less salt

Best dumplings ever. I used 1/4 tsp salt, but will decrease thyme next time just due to personal preference. Otherwise, yummy, fluffy, and packed with flavor. This will replace recipe I have used for years.
Best dumplings ever. This will be the only recipe for dumplings for me from now on.

Loved these. There is a notation about the salt being to high and should only be about half. Since I do not cook with salt did not and had not planned to add. Did not miss it as the dried spices added the flavour that they needed. Will be making again.
awesome dumplings

Dumplings turned out very light and fluffy. Found the herbs to be overpowering. Will cut them in half next time I make them (including the salt). Very simple ingredients and quick & easy to make. Thank you for this recipe.

They swell up pretty good. I 1-1/2 times the recipe, and my pot was filled enough I had to change to a bigger pot. I think one recipe would have been enough even for my 7 hungry mouths. I will likely use it again.

Delicious! As per original poster I lowered salt to 1/4 tsp and that was fine. I probably put 3/4 tsp of each of the herbs (tailoring to a child a bit) and substituted basil for parsley (personal preference). They were so good. The Kid loved them, said they tasted like stuffing, a high compliment. 

I mixed it up as directed, made 12 balls and dropped into my simmering stew. I covered it with a lid and didn't peek for 15 minutes, although I had to turn the stew down because it was boiling over. After 15 minutes the dumplings looked sorta like brains and I was kind of worried but they tasted great, had great texture and were cooked in the middle. My husband kept saying, "I can't believe you boiled bread and it cooked in the middle!" 

Saving this recipe, the family wants these again. Thanks!

I used entirely different herbs, but followed the rest of the ingredients almost exactly.I also made the mistake of putting the dumplings in to o small of a pot, and had to transfer them halfway through cooking, into a bigger pot.
They came out a little dense, but I think it's the pot issue.
I used my kitchen aid mixer to mix everything up.
I'll be using this recipe next time. Thanks!

Delicious! I wanted to make dumplings and panicked upon realizing I had no bisquick! It's the only way I have ever made dumplings. Now I may never need bisquick again! All recipes you have done it again! I had no milk so I used water and they turned out just fine. I did cut the salt as suggested but for me the herbs were just fun be! I will use th his recipe again!!
good combination of herbs for chicken and dumplings
Made these with chicken and dumplings recipe on this site and they were great! Definitely took them longer than 15 minutes to rise though.
First dumplings I've ever made. They were better than my Grandma's! Nobody cooks better than my Grandma. Until now. ;) Thanks for such deliciousness!!
So easy and tasty - far better than the standard dumpling, I loved the savory flavors!
I wish i read the reviews again b4 making it.. waaaay too salty..
I didn't cut back on anything, as a matter of fact I added garlic powder and added a little more of the other seasonings. We all loved it including the picky 20 year old.
Good with or without the herbs. I use liquid oil in place of the butter to make it easier without problems. Good with any soup or stew!

I tried this recipe for the first time today and was very pleased. Luckily, I had read some of the reviews and cut back on the salt, but I was a bit suspicious of the amount to begin with and very likely would have cut it back anyway. These dumplings were light and delicious, very enjoyable. I added two tablespoons of sour cream with the milk because we enjoy that taste. I have to say one thing though, I used a tablespoon and a half cookie scoop to drop the dough in and I still got 22 dumplings. I can't imagine how you could 'drop by rounded tablespoons' would only yield 6 dumplings. I almost doubled the recipe - thank goodness I didn't.
Very easy and delish! Changed some of the seasons to accommodate what I had available at home and it worked very well. Will make again:)

This is the basic dumpling recipe I got from my mom without the herbs. It is 5-stars just "plain"; I'm sure the herbs add a whole other dimension. I won't make beef stew without these. And yes, cut the salt in half!

These were absolutely delicious! Delicate, light, fluffy, perfect dumplings. I did note the suggestion of the original poster (Ronnastefan) and cut back the salt to 1/4 to 1/2 tsp... This is such a versatile recipe with herbs that can easily be changed to complement any dish that would benefit from dumplings. Will definitely become one of my "go to" recipes. Thanks so much for posting it.

I halved the salt and thyme and added half a teaspoon of basil. I like my dumplings herby. The flavor was awesome. Be careful not to cook for too long or the dumplings will dissolve; they add flavor and thickness to the broth if they dissolve, though.
Halve all the spices. awsome dumplings

I've used this recipe a few times-- it's fantastic! 
I make it with "chicken and dumplings II" from allrecipes.com.

I accidentally used 3 teaspoons instead of 3 tablespoons tonight and it still turned out great! This is a keeper.

Thankyou for this recipe Ronna,I have just made it,and They were lovely! I only needed just over 2/4 of the milk,and luckily read the reviews about the salt first ;) It is the first time I have attempted to make them from scratch,and Im so happy I did..Will always make my own from now on..And would recommend this recipe..
Delicious and easy to make! Thank you!
YUM! used these dumplings on top of beef stew. Followed the directions exactly as written

I threw these on top of a crock pot chicken and dumpling recipe instead of the standard dumplings, and my family raved about them. Really, any combination of herbs will be delicious, just customize to compliment the flavors of the dish.
I have made these dumplings twice, exactly as the recipe states and my family loves them (1 tsp salt). I will continue to make them this way!!
Very Very Good! I love chicken and dumplings and these dumplings are the best!
This is my go-to, never-fail recipe for dumplings to go in stew. Excellent!
Thanks. These are delicious and easy to make with on hand ingredients. This is my go to dumpling recipe. Try, you wouldn't be disappointed.

I didn't have all of the spices that it called for so I improvised by adding a little Italian seasoning with what spices I did have. Also added garlic powder and cheddar cheese. I put them in my chili and they were great! My husband liked them too. Mine took longer to cook but that was due to I made these, not in something just them by themselves, to take to my parents for THANKSgiving. My mom and my brother used the leftovers for Sausage Gravy Biscuit and said they added a great taste to it.

These were some of the best dumplings I have ever tasted. I love the herbs and they were so easy to make. My daughter who hates anything doughy asked if I could make them every night. They are very light and fluffy and so very flavorful. Try them with your next stew you will love 'em!
Excellent! My husband loved it. It reminded him of Grandma's recipe.
My partner raved about these dumplings with the chicken stew we had!
Excellent! I'm not a fan of dumplings but these were delicious, great flavor and texture. My boyfriend thought they were wonderful too!

These are wonderful. I used less salt and spices to suit my childrens taste. Turned out light and fluffy. My dumpling recipe for beef stew and chicken and dumplings. Have used buttermilk because I had to use it up. Really yummy too. Thanks for your recipe.
